      • getScope

        public java.util.Set<RandomVariable> getScope()
        Specified by:
        getScope in interface Proposition
        Returns:
        the Set of RandomVariables in the World (sample space) that this Proposition is applicable to.

      • getUnboundScope

        public java.util.Set<RandomVariable> getUnboundScope()
        Specified by:
        getUnboundScope in interface Proposition
        Returns:
        the Set of RandomVariables from this propositions scope that are not constrained to any particular set of values (e.g. bound = P(Total = 11), while unbound = P(Total)). If a variable is unbound it implies the distributions associated with the variable is being sought.

      • holds

        public abstract boolean holds(java.util.Map<RandomVariable,java.lang.Object> possibleWorld)
        Description copied from interface: Proposition
        Determine whether or not the proposition holds in a particular possible world.
        Specified by:
        holds in interface Proposition
        Parameters:
        possibleWorld - A possible world is defined to be an assignment of values to all of the random variables under consideration.
        Returns:
        true if the proposition holds in the given possible world, false otherwise.
